Major_Events: Renounced wealth and family ties to embrace a life of poverty; Founded the Franciscan Order; Received the stigmata in 1224; Canonized in 1228
Name: Saint Francis of Assisi
Notable_Contributions: Founded the Order of Friars Minor, the Poor Clares, and the Third Order; Promoted radical poverty and simplicity; Advocated for ecological stewardship
Quotes: Preach the Gospel at all times and when necessary use words; Start by doing what is necessary; then do what is possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.

Major_Events: Founded the Missionaries of Charity in 1948; Received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1979; Canonized as a saint on September 4, 2016
Name: Saint Mother Teresa of Calcutta
Notable_Contributions: Established homes for the dying, leprosy clinics, and orphanages; Served the poorest of the poor in Calcutta; Inspired global humanitarian efforts
Patron_Of: Missionaries of Charity; Archdiocese of Calcutta; World Youth Day
Quotes: I am a little pencil in the hand of God who is sending a love letter to the world.; In this life we cannot do great things. We can only do small things with great love.

Major_Events: Captured by Irish raiders at age 14 and taken to Ireland as a slave; Escaped from slavery after a dream from God; Ordained as a priest by St. Germanus and later as a bishop; Returned to Ireland to spread Christianity
Name: Saint Patrick
Notable_Contributions: Converted most of Ireland to Christianity; Used the shamrock to explain the Trinity; Established the first church in Ireland at Saul
Quotes: The love of God and his fear grew in me more and more, as did the faith, and my soul was roused, so that, in a single day, I have said as many as a hundred prayers and in the night, nearly the same.
